alert.note: Alert for City of Hopewell; City of Petersburg (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 1:09AM EST until January 11 at 5:43AM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST THIS MORNING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central, east central, and south central Virginia, including the following counties and independent cities, in central Virginia, Chesterfield and Henrico. In east central Virginia, Charles City and New Kent. In south central Virginia, City of Hopewell, City of Petersburg and Prince George. * WHEN...Until 700 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 107 AM EST, VDOT reported standing water due to heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Flooding impacts will continue, but little to no additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Petersburg, Hopewell, Colonial Heights, Roxbury, Talleysville, Fort Gregg-Adams, Chester, Prince George, Bottoms Bridge, Jordans Point, Tunstall, Wayside, Glendale, Elko, Barnetts, Wrights Corner, Meadowville, Orapax Farms, Mountcastle and New Kent Airport. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

area.areaDesc: City of Hopewell; City of Petersburg
